title: Fix your banning system please
body:
I just got banned 14 days and lost my honor rank / rewards for writing kys to someone being toxic.

He was telling my friend how to play ( note that my friend wasn't feeding and he wasn't trash talking ) in a harsh manner.
Even after I told him "He mains j4" "D/w about it" he kept being toxic.
So I wrote kys, stop talking trash.
A very common expression that shouldn't deserve a 14 days insta ban ESPECIALLY in that context.

The guy who reported me legit talked shit to my friend all game even if we were winning and he was playing just fine.
Everytime my friend would do the tinniest mistake the guy would point it out.
Simple stuff that adds up and gets really annoying.
But I'm the one who gets banned and I'm willing to bet he didn't get banned ( I didn't report him, I just ignored him and so did my friend ).

So what's up with that.

Why give so much power to certain words over 1 report.
Atleast make it a repeated offense system, 14 days and honor loss is way over what I should have gotten ( let's be honnest, I don't even deserve a warning, what I did wasn't even toxic ).

It didn't affect our game, I didn't offend anyone, the guy was just being a dick and I pointed it out trying to stand up for my friend.

I wrote kys but I didn't threaten him, I didn't attack him personally, I didn't bully him, I didn't annoy him, I didn't swear, I can keep going on what I didn't do.
The only thing I can say I did is I wrote kys to a guy being seriously toxic. THAT'S IT.

replies.body:
In 2017 you can't asnwer back to people and that's really fucking lame. If someone is flaming you , don't answer back beacuse YOU will be banned and not him. If someone is feeding your game on purpose DO NOT flame him because YOU will get banned. 

Riot tribunal is a fucking joke. '' kys '' is not even toxic. We're in 2k17 GROW THE FUCK UP. Too much sensitive morons in this games , if you can't take the word '' kys '' just leave the goddamn internet.

I haven't played in years.
Back in my days it would take A LOT to get banned and you wouldn't instantly get banned for 14 days.
I believe it was a repeated offense system.

Now, I'm not saying it's a bad thing they're trying to make the community less toxic, but this is outrageous.
At this point, those bans are more toxic than the people you're banning.
And it seems like it happens to a lot of people.
I've had 2 friends banned 14 days for similar reasons.

It seems like the only thing to do at this point is to ignore your team and mute chat to make sure you don't offend anyone WHICH is extremely idiotic since it's a cooperative game and muting your teammates will just hurt your team.

As you can imagine, telling someone to kill themselves over a video game is preeeetty extreme and isn't taken very lightly by a majority of the playerbase. Certain things aren't okay within the game, just like they aren't accepted in real life scenarios, and [**can result in skipping certain levels of punishment**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286#h1q4).

That's the problem.
People all over the world use words and expressions that doesn't necessarily mean the same thing from a person to another.
People have different point of views when it comes to what's toxic / offensive and different levels of understanding of the english language.

I'm french and we have an expression in french which goes a bit like "Go hang yourself / Va te pendre".
When I say that it's a bit like a facepalm ( someone did something stupid ) or because the person is being annoying.
The closest thing in english for me is kys.
It's as if you'd tell someone "Go play in traffic".
You're obviously not telling him to literally go play in traffic.
You just want him to "get lost" cause he's being obnoxious.

Even between friends we say kys when one of us does something stupid or annoying.
We're not being toxic tho it's just an expression.

That's why I believe this is unfair.

I politely / indirectly told him to stop.
He wouldn't so I told him to stop trash talking ( and wrote kys ).
In that context kys is like saying "go play in traffic".
It's not literal, it's used as an expression to tell him to shut up.
I ignored him for the rest of the game even tho he kept flaming and even tho I hadn't muted him in case he wrote something helpful, so tell me, how am I not behaving myself there?
Is telling someone to shut up when they're being obnoxious seriously considered toxic.
Is it really toxic enough to justify a 14 days ban without warning / past offense.
If you think they should have been banned why didn't you report them?

In all honesty, I simply didn't care enough.
I built a thick skin over the years, the internet is a toxic place.
I don't go out of my way to report people unless they're being extremely toxic or if it affects someone besides me.
The guy was flaming my friend the whole game but it didn't affect him or anyone else.
I guess I will from now on.

I don't get why it is so hard for some people to understand a zero tolerance rule.
Zero tolerance means there is no arguing, no discussing it. It means, you write that kind of stuff, regardless of context, the ban hammer gets dropped on you.
This is not a place to argue whether this is harsh, out of context, or whatever. 
Don't write those words, and you won't ever get punished, it's that easy. 
If you cant follow this simple rule, expect to get banned. What are you, 12?

I don't get how you think I don't get that it's a zero tolerance rule.
I'm not arguing for my ban to be removed or anything like that.
I know it won't happen.
I'm arguing because I have an opinion I want to voice, an opinion which I'M FREE to share with people.
This opinion is straight forward, I just don't agree with how things are handled.
Also, good job with the "What are you, 12?". Shows how mature you are.

It shows you don't get it, because you keep arguing how unfair it is and how you shouldn't be punished. In this thread alone like what, 5-6 times? **That **shows you don't get it (To answer your question).

You're right, a ban lift won't happen. 100%.

Of course you're free to share your opinion. But if your opinion consists only of whining around how you got banned because you were offensive and how unfair everyone is to you, and how you don't deserve this unfair treatment from the bad bad Riot people, then this leads to the assumption that you either:

a) don't understand what a 0 tolerance rule is
or
b) are about 12 years old and throw a fit if you don't get what you want, because it works on mommy and daddy.

Sorry.
